acf.name: Combi Boiler
acf.description: A combi boiler provides heat for your radiators and domestic hot water on demand.

acf.name: Biomass Boiler
acf.description: Wood-fuelled heating systems, or biomass systems, burn varieties of wood to either warm a single room or to provide central heating and hot water.

acf.name: Micro CHP Boiler
acf.description: Micro combined heat and power (micro-CHP) is a technology which generates heat and electricity simultaneously.

acf.name: Solar water heater
acf.description: Solar water heating systems, or 'solar thermal' systems, use free heat from the sun to warm domestic hot water.

acf.name: Ground source heat pump
acf.description: Ground source heat pumps (GSHPs) use pipes that are buried in the garden to extract heat from the ground.
acf.space_requirement: Space for the pipes (underground in a garden of at least 400 square metres) and the heat pump (a small room or outbuilding)

acf.name: Air source heat pump
acf.description: Air source heat pumps (ASHPs) absorb heat from the outside air and use it to heat your home.

acf.name: Regular Boiler
acf.description: Regular boilers (also known as 'conventional' boilers) heat your central heating system directly and produce hot water for your cylinder.
acf.space_requirement: Room for cylinder (a full-length cupboard) and tank (a loft or very large cupboard)

acf.name: System Boiler
acf.description: A system boiler has components housed externally from the boiler and will normally require cold water, as well as feed and expansion tanks in the loft.
